unnormalised: AIIMS Delhi faced a surge in emergency cases last night, mostly related to heatstroke and dehydration. Dr. Sharma mentioned seeing a 25% increase compared to last week. Many patients were brought in unconscious and required immediate IV fluids.
normalised: A-I-I-M-S Delhi faced a surge in emergency cases last night, mostly related to heatstroke and dehydration. Doctor Sharma mentioned seeing a twenty five percent increase compared to last week. Many patients were brought in unconscious and required immediate I-V fluids.

unnormalised: Sources report that most affected were daily wage laborers and auto-rickshaw drivers working under the scorching sun. The hospital staff worked tirelessly till 3:00 AM to stabilize everyone. One patient, Mr. Verma, a 62 yr old, was particularly critical.
normalised: Sources report that most affected were daily wage laborers and auto-rickshaw drivers working under the scorching sun. The hospital staff worked tirelessly till three A-M to stabilize everyone. One patient, Mister Verma, a sixty two year old, was particularly critical.

unnormalised: The hospital spokesperson urged people to stay hydrated and avoid prolonged exposure to the sun between 11 AM and 4 PM. They also advised carrying ORS packets and seeking immediate medical help at the nearest hospital in case of any discomfort. You know, prevention is better than cure, right?
normalised: The hospital spokesperson urged people to stay hydrated and avoid prolonged exposure to the sun between eleven A-M and four P-M. They also advised carrying O-R-S packets and seeking immediate medical help at the nearest hospital in case of any discomfort. You know, prevention is better than cure, right?

unnormalised: Free cooling stations have been set up across the city by the govt to help people cope with the heat wave. The health ministry is also planning to launch a public awareness campaign starting 15/06/2024. Let's hope things improve soon!
